document_data.name: Bowl of Hares
document_data.mainbody: '''Bowl of hares''' was one of the specialty dishes from the [[Oak-Father's Boon]], the best inn in [[Mosstone]], [[Tethyr]].
document_data.Description: A typical bowl of hares' main ingredient was, very appropriately, [[hare]]. The beast's meat was diced and stewed for half a day in a rich sauce of [[clove]]s, [[cinnamon]], and finely chopped [[leek]]s. The dish was served in a bowl alongside toasted slices of [[eggbread]].
document_data.History: Bowl of hares was served at the Boon in the mid-to-late-14{{th}} century [[DR]]. The dish was mentioned by [[Volothamp Geddarm]]'s rave review of the inn in one of his published travel guides.
